basics.name: Isabella Mow
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in engineering from the College of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2029.

work.summary: Conducts checks, audits, and maintenance on UHM Information and Technology Services Data Centers and UH networks.
highlights: Training to support data centers on campus and network operations by running patches, server maintenance, conducting audits, and more.

work.company: Research Corporation of the University of Hawaii
work.summary: Part time job at Kalihi Palama Public Library serving the public under the Department of Health.
highlights: Facilitated library users to find, schedule, and do telehealth visits. Collected evaluation data/feedback from users and staff for project activities.

work.company: Research Corporation of the University of Hawaii
work.summary: Full time job at Komohana Research Center under UH Manoa College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources (CTAHR)
highlights: Propagated ulu & banana species, made media, cleaned flasks, maintained cleanliness of lab, wrote progress reports for grants.

Internships.position: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Intern
Internships.summary: Worked to identify novel diffusion model interpolator for land usage on Hawaii Island.
highlights: Used a pre-trained model with a mask feature that was adapted to infill unknown data points with the goal of matching the ground truth image.
The goal of the project was to create an  accurate graph with a level of uncertainty that simulates climate scientists going to an area and identifying its landscapes to reduce resources and cost.

volunteering.summary: Non-profit program designed to provide local students an international experience by hosting a four day camp showcasing STEM resources across Hawaii Island to international schools.
highlights: Helped commit 25k+ to funding by presenting to potential donors.
Assisted in planning program activities and logistics.

awards.title: Hawaii B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.

references.name: Noa Lincoln, Primary Investigator of the Indigenous Cropping Systems Laboratory, nlincoln@hawaii.edu, (808) 217-7710
